item.title: There are no ushers on Mastodon
item.description: TL;DR: There are no ushers on Mastodon. There's no one paid to show you to your seat, no one whose job it is to ease you into comfort and remove friction.

item.title: Twitter, or social cowardice as a service
item.description: TL;DR: Yeah, yeah, I'm navel gazing about Twitter over here.

item.title: My summer spent avoiding a writing habit
Writing Habit Recap No. 3
item.description: TL;DR: I'd meant to do these recap posts every week. But, oops: it's been a month since the last one. Now that I sit down to write this, though, I think I've done more than I thought.

item.title: Writing Habit Recap No. 2
item.description: TL;DR: I've gotten through over a month of writing posted here. I thought it might be worth reflecting and recapping again.

item.title: Writing Habit Recap No. 1
item.description: TL;DR: I've gotten through twenty days of writing posted here. I thought it might be worth recapping the last few things I managed to post.

item.title: Building a New Creative Writing Habit
item.description: TL;DR: I'm trying to build a new creative writing habit. The immediate form that this has taken is a goal of writing 300 words of fiction per day that I post to my blog. I've been using 3-card spreads from a Tarot deck to supply writing prompts. I'm hoping I keep it up.

item.title: Writing while burnt out
item.description: TL;DR: I'm trying to build a daily creative writing habit. This post is the result of an exercise toward that end. It's probably an awful first draft of a little flash fiction scene, unless I've tried something especially weird or decided to write something meta. Let me know what you think!

item.title: How to build your own Easy-Blog Oven
item.description: TL;DR: I wanted to write more about building my Easy-Blog Oven. I mainly glued together things I already knew, but I think I learned some things and had some surprises anyway.

item.title: Easy-Blog Oven
item.description: TL;DR: I made a new static site generator for my blog. It's not very clever. I've been calling it my "Easy-Blog Oven" and it seems to be working well so far.

item.title: Heartbroken
item.description: TL;DR: My heart is broken. Less shitposting. More thinking. Hopefully something productive, soon.

item.title: Continual Blogployment
item.description: Ever since I switched this blog over to a Gulp-based toolchain - holy crap, 2 years ago - I had a TODO to wire this thing up for continual deployment. Well, today I finally did it.

item.title: Toot = Tiny Outburst of Text
item.description: I've been toying with something Twitterish lately, and thought I needed a different word to describe the central social object. So, I started using toot, which means "tiny outburst of text". Of course, I started by making fart jokes to myself before that expansion appeared in my head. But, I think it's fun.

item.title: What were all those bullets for?
item.description: Did you see that thing I just posted? Weird. Back when I used Dave Winer's OPML Editor, I used to have a daily habit of opening a new outline and popping over to it throughout the day to collect random thoughts.
